record.description: McDonald Observatory of the University of Texas located atop 6,800-foot Mt. Locke in the Davis Mountains will be dedicated May 5, 1939. The observatory, which the University of Texas built with a bequest from the late William J. McDonald, Paris, Texas banker, is 71 feet high surmounted by a hemispherical dome 62 feet in diameter and weighing 115 tons. The 82-inch reflecting mirror telescope is presently the second largest in the world. Astronomers of the University of Chicago led by Dr. Otto Struve, Director of the Yerkes Observatory, will provide staffing.
